revised_title: Kolmogorov's Ideas 50 Years On: A New Perspective on Homogeneous Turbulence
tldr: This article presents a review of recent results on homogeneous turbulence and discusses the interpretation and understanding of these flows using direct numerical simulations and phenomenological models. The authors propose a new perspective on the dynamics of turbulence, integrating Kolmogorov's theory with intermittency effects. They develop a quantitative model for the statistics of homogeneous turbulent flows, considering mean-distortion and self-distortion of eddies as key processes affecting energy transfer from large to small scales.
